sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Hello and Happy New Year from all of us here at Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Let's take a look at the latest headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The French government cuts coronavirus isolation periods for fully vaccinated people from 10 to 7 days, while scientists agree the Abikrad variant causes less lung damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sudanese Prime Minister Abdullah Hamdok steps down after months of widespread pro-democracy protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: His resignation throws the country into political uncertainty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And we look at the new law in Austria that allows terminally ill people the right to end their own lives. France is reducing the isolation period for fully vaccinated people who test positive for COVID-19.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: From today, January 3rd, it's being cut from 10 to 7 days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: President Macron's government is the latest to reduce isolation periods in a bid to keep the economy functioning as the Omicron variant spreads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: in a bid to keep the economy functioning as the Omicron variant spreads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: France's National Assembly is also set to vote on changing the country's health pass into a vaccination pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It comes after a record few days in daily new infections topping 200,000, although there was a dip in reported cases following the public holiday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In England, masks are now to be worn in classrooms by secondary school pupils.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Their temporary reintroduction aims to keep schools open for face-to-face learning this coming term. With soaring daily infections, Cabinet ministers are set to review anti-Covid restrictions for England on Wednesday. In Russia, the authorities in the city of St Petersburg are introducing tougher measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: All restaurants and bars and public places in general will only be able to admit those who have a negative PCR test or a QR code proving they've been vaccinated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And in Greece, citizens are now being told to use double masks or high protection masks to enter grocery stores and public transport.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, as Omicron infections continue to rise, there is a positive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's a growing consensus among the scientific community that the highly transmissible Covid variant inflicts less damage on the lungs of those infected.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Protesters were involved in scuffles with police in Amsterdam on Sunday as thousands of people took part in anti-Covid demonstrations in the Dutch capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: of people took part in anti-covid demonstrations in the Dutch capital. The city's mayor, Femke Halsema, issued an emergency decree at 1pm on Sunday prohibiting a rally in Museum Square.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Given the required social distancing of 1.5 metres, authorities calculated that that would allow for a crowd of up to 3,500 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the mayor considered that many more than that would turn up and it would therefore have been impossible to comply with the restriction and so she went ahead and issued the short-term decree.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But another demonstration in the Westerpark district had been approved for a crowd of up to 2,000 people. Officials said by early afternoon that threshold was reached.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Due to a strike, the Amsterdam police didn't have its usual mobile intervention force at its disposal. The special unit has been complaining of a high workload and lack of personnel and announced it would only be on hand in the event of serious rioting. As it turned out, the rallies were largely peaceful. Many sectors of the Netherlands' economy and public life are currently lying idle due to the pandemic, including cultural and sports facilities and stores that don't sell food or everyday goods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Sudan's Prime Minister has announced his resignation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sudan's Prime Minister has announced his resignation. This comes amid political deadlock and months of widespread pro-democracy protests following October's military coup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In an address to the nation, Abdullah Hamdok called for dialogue to agree a national charter and to draw a roadmap to complete the transition to democracy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Prior to his resignation, Sudanese security forces had violently dispersed pro-democracy demonstrators, killing at least two people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hamdok's departure comes less than two months after being reinstated as part of an agreement with the military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: During that time he failed to name a cabinet, while his resignation throws Sudan into political uncertainty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: October's coup upended Sudan's plans to move to democracy after a popular uprising forced the military to overthrow long-time autocrat Omar al-Bashir.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A large fire has completely destroyed the National Assembly building where parliamentarians

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: sit in the South African city of Cape Town.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: No casualties have been reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A 51-year-old man is being held and questioned by authorities, according to the police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Cyril Ramaphosa visited the scene and called it a terrible and devastating event, but praised the emergency services' hard work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They have done a fantastic job.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Had they not responded in the six minutes that they told me they responded with I think we would be talking about the National Assembly and the Council of Houses provinces being in ashes complete ashes an investigation has been opened into the blaze which started in the early hours of Sunday the complex's oldest wing which was completed in 1884 and had wood-panelled rooms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Problems with the fire alarm and sprinkler systems have been reported.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Parliament is not currently sitting because of the holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Search teams in Colorado are still looking for two missing people among the snow-covered yet smoldering debris after last week's massive wildfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Colorado's Governor Jared Polis toured destroyed neighborhoods in Boulder County on Sunday after he witnessed first-hand the devastation caused by the massive wildfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Nearly 1,000 homes and other buildings have been destroyed between Denver and Boulder County.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The blaze came unusually late in the year following an extremely dry autumn amid a winter devoid of snow, until now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As families trudged through the snow to determine the condition of their homes, one man was brought to tears by what he saw.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: You know, the kids' playground is just down the street over there and I can buy new books, I can buy new furniture but it's really hard to build back a community and friends and a social network like that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: US President Joe Biden has declared the scenes a national disaster and has freed up federal funds to assist affected people and businesses in their recovery efforts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A new law has come into effect in Austria allowing people who are terminally ill to end their own lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Euronews reporter Johannes Plaschberger has more from Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The prerequisite for assisted suicide in Austria is that the person willing to die must be of age and seriously ill in the long term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Two different doctors must then confirm this, including whether the person willing to die is at all capable of making such a decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The lethal drug will be available in pharmacies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Almost all parties have voted in favor of the so-called death decree law, except for the opposition party FPÖ, according to which it has not been clarified what will happen with the lethal drug if it is not or only partially used.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Much criticism comes from the Catholic Church, which is dominant in Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The chairman of the bishops' conference called the legal approval of assisted suicide the most serious event of the past year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The church had also announced that it would ban the new legal practice in its own hospitals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The new law was prompted by a decision of the Constitutional Court that the previous ban on assisted suicide was unconstitutional.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The government then consulted with experts on how best to prevent abuse and reduce the desire for early termination of life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For example, more money will now be made available for hospice and palliative care because it should not be up to personal circumstances or income levels what care conditions a person finds at the end of life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Johannes Blechberger, Euronews, Vienna.
